Keywords: X-Men
Real Name: Charles Xavier
Special Powers
X-MEN HEADMASTER: Leadership. When Professor X uses it and succeeds, you may give an adjacent friendly character with a RALLY trait a RALLY die.

Comments
August 30, 2021
Darkheart
Actually, both the FFs dial and the regular set one are interesting and very playable. Are they busted AF like the GSX one was when it came out, well no. But these are definitely worth their points just like HoX028, XXS037a and XXS037b are. Chuck may have had several middling to pathetic dials in that post GSX time frame but he's had some decent ones as well. In quantity AND quality he's done tons better than the average tier 2 character in the same time frame. Professor Brood is one of my all time favorites and I still break him out on occasion.
August 14, 2021
Goop
I suppose you can carry him around and he can do some outwitting while rolling leadership to hopefully give you a rally die. If you have him with Lilandra and Moira you can really get some things going and potentially a lot of rallys out fast.
May 31, 2021
Organous
That's because this one is not wheelchair-bound. He's up and walking.
May 30, 2021
ANANSI
Yeah, even for a measley 40 points this dial is lackluster. Also, his speed is rather high for a wheelchair bound paraplegic.
May 29, 2021
Buckwheat
Like the Bostonians who endured the Curse of the Bambino, Chuck's fans must suffer the Curse of the Cerebro. Since the absurdly good, if not unfair, GSX incarnation of the character, with the infamous Trait, from which the curse derives its name, Xavier's dials have been exceptionally poor.
